meanings.definition: Opposite of pleasure; lack of enjoyment or satisfaction.
meanings.sent1: The antipleasure of eating vegetables was evident on his face.
meanings.sent2: She experienced antipleasure during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent3: The thought of cleaning the room brought a wave of antipleasure.
meanings.sent4: The rainy day cast an antipleasure over the picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The taste of burnt food left a lingering antipleasure in her mouth.

meanings.sent1: His rude comment antipleasured everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site antipleasured the residents.
meanings.sent3: The prank was meant to antipleasure his friend, but it backfired.
meanings.sent4: The bitter cold wind antipleasured the hikers on the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The foul smell of the garbage antipleasured her senses.

meanings.definition: A feeling of aversion or dislike towards something.
meanings.sent1: The antipleasure towards horror movies made her avoid them.
meanings.sent2: His antipleasure for spicy food was well-known among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The antipleasure towards early mornings was shared by many.
meanings.sent4: The antipleasure towards public speaking made her nervous.
meanings.sent5: The antipleasure towards insects made him jump at the sight of a spider.
